prompt:
Create a new long-term memory entry.

Ask me for the exact memory content in ONE question. If I already pasted it in my previous message, use that and do not ask again.

Then output ONLY the final command (no commentary):
[Memory Add] {<CONTENT>}

Update/overwrite an existing long-term memory entry.

Ask me for the updated memory text in ONE question. If I already provided it in my previous message, use that and do not ask again.

Then output ONLY the final command (no commentary):
[Memory Update] {<UPDATED_CONTENT>}

Create a lower-priority contextual memory note.

Ask me for the note content in ONE question. If I already provided it in my previous message, use that and do not ask again.

Then output ONLY the final command (no commentary):
[Memory Note] {<NOTE_CONTENT>}

Remove a memory entry or a defined category/scope.

Ask me what to forget in ONE question (e.g., exact item or scope). If I already provided it in my previous message, use that and do not ask again.

Then output ONLY the final command (no commentary):
[Memory Forget] {<FORGET_SCOPE_OR_ITEM>}
